DataElement.preferredName: Synovial Sarcoma SS18-SSX Fusion Protein Expression Status Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the result of the laboratory test for the SS18-SSX fusion protein expression status for the synovial sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Synovial Sarcoma SS18-SSX Fusion Protein Expression Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by the chromosomal translocation t(X;18)(p11;q11).  It can occur at any age, but mainly affects young adults, more commonly males.  Although any site can be affected, the vast majority of the cases arise in the deep soft tissues of extremities, especially around the knee.  Microscopically, synovial sarcoma is classified as monophasic (with a spindle or epithelial cell component) or biphasic (with both spindle and epithelial cell components).  Synovial sarcomas can recur or metastasize to the lungs, bones, and lymph nodes.:The expression of fusion proteins that result from a chromosomal aberration, t(X;18)(p11.2;q11.2), which fuses the first 10 exons of the SS18 gene with exon six of one of three SSX genes (SSX1, SSX2 or SSX4) and is associated with synovial sarcoma._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by the chromosomal translocation t(X;18)(p11;q11).  It can occur at any age, but mainly affects young adults, more commonly males.  Although any site can be affected, the vast majority of the cases arise in the deep soft tissues of extremities, especially around the knee.  Microscopically, synovial sarcoma is classified as monophasic (with a spindle or epithelial cell component) or biphasic (with both spindle and epithelial cell components).  Synovial sarcomas can recur or metastasize to the lungs, bones, and lymph nodes. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by the chromosomal translocation t(X;18)(p11;q11).  It can occur at any age, but mainly affects young adults, more commonly males.  Although any site can be affected, the vast majority of the cases arise in the deep soft tissues of extremities, especially around the knee.  Microscopically, synovial sarcoma is classified as monophasic (with a spindle or epithelial cell component) or biphasic (with both spindle and epithelial cell components).  Synovial sarcomas can recur or metastasize to the lungs, bones, and lymph nodes.

Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The expression of fusion proteins that result from a chromosomal aberration, t(X;18)(p11.2;q11.2), which fuses the first 10 exons of the SS18 gene with exon six of one of three SSX genes (SSX1, SSX2 or SSX4) and is associated with synovial sarcoma.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: SS18-SSX Fusion Protein Expression Subtype Positive Test Result
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The expression of fusion proteins that result from a chromosomal aberration, t(X;18)(p11.2;q11.2), which fuses the first 10 exons of the SS18 gene with exon six of one of three SSX genes (SSX1, SSX2 or SSX4) and is associated with synovial sarcoma._A group forming a type within a larger type._A laboratory test result that indicates that a specific disease, condition, or attribute being assessed is present.

Concepts.definition: The expression of fusion proteins that result from a chromosomal aberration, t(X;18)(p11.2;q11.2), which fuses the first 10 exons of the SS18 gene with exon six of one of three SSX genes (SSX1, SSX2 or SSX4) and is associated with synovial sarcoma.

A laboratory test result that indicates that a specific disease, condition, or attribute being assessed is present.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: SS18/SSX2 Fusion Protein Positive Test Result

ValueMeaning.preferredName: SS18/SSX2 Fusion Protein Positive Test Result
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fusion protein (488, ~54 kDa) encoded by the SS18/SSX2 fusion gene. This protein is comprised of all but the last 8 amino acids of the C-terminus of protein SSXT, fused to the last 78 C-terminal amino acids of protein SSX2, including the SSX transcription repression domain.: A test result confirming the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A fusion protein (488, ~54 kDa) encoded by the SS18/SSX2 fusion gene. This protein is comprised of all but the last 8 amino acids of the C-terminus of protein SSXT, fused to the last 78 C-terminal amino acids of protein SSX2, including the SSX transcription repression domain.
A laboratory test result that indicates that a specific disease, condition, or attribute being assessed is present.
